title: Three Casual Script Typefaces
content:
Hi, I was hoping for help identifying the following casual script typefaces.

Thanks in advance!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208063823im_/http:/typophile.com/files/allegro_6678.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208063823im_/http:/typophile.com/files/canopy_4928.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208063823im_/http:/typophile.com/files/pranzi_logo_4146.jpg)

 [‹ Lily UPC](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208063823/http:/typophile.com/node/46695 "Go to previous forum topic") [Helmut Newton & Playboy fonts ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208063823/http:/typophile.com/node/46659 "Go to next forum topic")
author: showandtell

comments.content: ‘Pranzi’ is [Miss Le Gatees](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208063823/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000075) and ‘Canopy’ is very close to [ITC Dartangnon](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208063823/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/itc_dartangnon_std_regular).
Amazing, thanks so much for those quick IDs!

I would think “allegro” is hand-drawn. The way the letters connect, and the different ’l’s suggest that.

- Lex
